intro: Lesquerella condensata var. laevis, commonly known as the smooth lesquerella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. The plant belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other economically important species. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils in arid environments. Its botanical significance lies in its potential for use in industrial applications due to its unique seed oil composition.
